properties.Name: BondEventRisk
properties.Description:
The risk that a bond will suddenly decline in credit quality and result in a lower rating because of a takeover-related event (i.e. - additional debt or recapitalization).

The risk that the ability of an issuer to make interest and principal payments will change because of (1) a natural or industrial accident or some regulatory change or (2) a takeover or corporate restructuring. 

Ex:

Standard & Poor's rates Event Risk on a range of E-1 (highest) to E-5 (lowest).

These ratings supplement the basic bond ratings.

Columns.Name: BondId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Financial Product.

Columns.Name: CreditRatingAgencyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Credit Rating Agency.

Columns.Name: BondRiskEventTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a bond event risk type.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date for which the associated bond Event Risk is prepared.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date for which the associated bond Event Risk is prepared.

Columns.Name: BondEventRiskRating
Columns.Description:
The bond Event Risk rating of the associated bond for the period defined.

Ex:

Standard & Poor's rates Event Risk on a range of E-1 (highest) to E-5 (lowest).

These ratings supplement the basic bond ratings.

Properties.Description:
The risk that a bond will suddenly decline in credit quality and result in a lower rating because of a takeover-related event (i.e. - additional debt or recapitalization).

The risk that the ability of an issuer to make interest and principal payments will change because of (1) a natural or industrial accident or some regulatory change or (2) a takeover or corporate restructuring. 

Ex:

Standard & Poor's rates Event Risk on a range of E-1 (highest) to E-5 (lowest).

These ratings supplement the basic bond ratings.
